unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Describe the Distribution
question_text: Here is a probability distribution for a random variable, $x$ ,  describing the grades a professor has given out over the years.  There are no plus or minus grades.  Here, an $A=5$ , a $B=4$ , etc. $x$ $1$ $ 2$ $3$ $4$ $5$ $p(x)$ $0.02$ $0.08$ $0.10$ $0.55$ $0.25$ Which of the following most closely describes the distribution?

choices.text: The distribution is skewed to the left.  Its center is a B B , and there is some amount of spread.
The distribution is skewed to the right.  Its center is a B B , and there is some amount of spread.
The distribution is skewed to the left.  Its center is a C C , and there is some amount of spread.
The distribution is symmetric.  Its center is a B B , and there is some amount of spread.
The distribution is symmetric.  Its center is a C C , and there is some amount of spread.
